intro: Asterolinon trinum, commonly known as the common aster, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually purple or blue, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Asterolinon trinum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
